\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul Be in enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone Section 1.  Statement of findings and purpose. The New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code (the \ldblquote New York State Energy Code\rdblquote ) is promulgated by the State Fire Prevention and Building Code Council pursuant to Article 11 of the New York State Energy Law.  In accordance with Article 11, the New York City Energy Conservation Code must be at least as strict as the New York State Energy Code.  The purpose of this local law is to conform the New York City Energy Conservation Code to recent changes in the New York State Energy Code with local law amendments unique to construction in the City.\par
\'a72.  Section 28-1001.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 1 for the year 2011, is amended to read as follows: \par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\b\'a728-1001.1\b0  \b Adoption of the \ul New York city\ulnone  energy \ul conservation\ulnone  code.\b0  In accordance with section 11-109 of the New York state energy law, which permits any municipality to promulgate a local energy conservation construction code, the city of New York hereby adopts the [2010 energy conservation construction code of New York state] \ul New York state energy code\ulnone  in effect and any amendments thereto that are more stringent than such code adopted by the city of New York as the minimum requirements for the design, construction and alteration of buildings for the effective use of energy in the city. Such adoption shall be subject to amendments pursuant to local law and set forth in section 1001.2 of this chapter, which shall be known and cited as the \ldblquote New York city amendments to the [2010 energy conservation construction code of New York state.\rdblquote  Such edition of the 2010 energy conservation construction code of New York state] \ul New York state energy code.\rdblquote  The New York state energy code\ulnone  with such New York city amendments shall together be known and cited as the \ldblquote New York city energy conservation code \ul (NYCECC)\ulnone .\rdblquote\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a73.  The administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 28-1001.1.1 to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\b\'a728-1001.1.1\b0  \b Definition\b0 .  As used in this chapter, the term \ldblquote New York State Energy Code\rdblquote  means the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code (the \ldblquote New York State Energy Code\rdblquote ), constituting part 1240 of title 19 of the New York codes, rules and regulations (19 NYCRR Part 1240), and the publications incorporated by reference in such part, promulgated on November 18, 2014 by the State Fire Prevention and Building Code Council pursuant to Article 11 of the New York State Energy Law.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\'a74.  Section 28-1001.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 1 for the year 2011, is REPEALED and a new section 28-1001.2 is added to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\b\'a728-1001.2 New York city amendments to the New York state energy code.\b0  The following New York city amendments to the New York state energy code are hereby adopted as set forth in sections 28-1001.2.1, 28-1001.2.2 and 28-1001.2.3.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\sl480\slmult1\qj\b\'a728-1001.2.1  New York city amendments to 19 NYCRR Part 1240.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj 1240.5  Exceptions.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\b0 Delete Exception (b) in its entirety and replace with a new Exception (b) to read as follows:\ulnone  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\ul\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li720\qj\ulnone\b\tab\ul (b) Certain alterations. \b0 The following need not comply with the provisions of the New York State Energy Code, provided that the energy use of the building is not increased:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-270\li990\qj 1. Storm windows installed over existing fenestration.\par
\par
2. Glass-only replacements in an existing sash and frame, provided that the U-factor and the solar heat gain coefficient (SHGC) shall be equal to or lower than before the glass replacement.\par
\par
3. Alterations, renovations or repairs to roof/ceiling, wall or floor cavities, including spaces between furring strips, provided that such cavities are insulated to the full existing cavity depth with insulation having a minimum nominal value of R-3.0/inch (R-2.0/cm).\par
\par
4. Alterations, renovations or repairs to walls and floors in cases where the existing structure is without framing cavities and no new framing cavities are created.\par
\par
5. Reroofing where neither the sheathing nor the insulation is exposed. Roofs without insulation in the cavity and where the sheathing or insulation is exposed during reroofing shall be insulated either above or below the sheathing.\par
\par
6. Replacement of existing doors that separate conditioned space from the exterior shall not require the installation of a vestibule or revolving door, provided, however, that an existing vestibule that separates a conditioned space from the exterior shall not be removed.\par
\par
7. An alteration that replaces less than 50 percent of the luminaires in a space, provided that such alteration does not increase the installed interior lighting power.\par
\par
8. An alteration that replaces only the bulb and ballast within the existing luminaires in a space, provided that such alteration does not increase the installed interior lighting power.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi1440\sl480\slmult1\qj\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a728-1001.2.2 New York city amendments to residential and  commercial chapters of the New York state energy code\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj CHAPTER 1\par
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj Chapter 1 is deleted in its entirety and a new Chapter 1 is added to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qc\ulnone\b\par
\ul CHAPTER 1\par
ADMINISTRATION\par
\ulnone\par
\ul Introductory Statement\par
\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b0\fs23\par
\fs24 The New York City Energy Conservation Code (\ldblquote NYCECC\rdblquote ) is comprised of the New York State Energy Code (\ldblquote NYSEC\rdblquote ) with amendments as enacted into law by the New York City Council.\par
\par
Reflecting changes in the New York State Energy Code, the NYCECC is divided into provisions relevant to residential buildings and provisions relevant to commercial buildings as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj 1.  The provisions of the NYCECC for residential buildings are reflected in the state publications incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR section 1240.3, as amended by sections 28-1001.2.1, 28-1001.2.2 and 28-1001.2.3 of the administrative code of the city of New York.  Such state publications include (i) Chapters 1, 2, 3, 4, and 6 of the 2010 ECCCNYS, as amended by Chapter 1 of the publication entitled the 2014 Supplement to the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code (the \ldblquote 2014 Supplement\rdblquote ); and (ii) the referenced standards incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR section 1240.3(b).\par
\par
2.  The provisions of the NYCECC for commercial buildings are reflected in the state publications incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR section 1240.4, as amended by sections 28-1001.2.1, 28-1001.2.2 and 28-1001.2.3 of the administrative code of the city of New York.  Such state  publications include (i) Chapter 1 of the 2010 ECCCNYS, as amended by Chapter 1 of the 2014 Supplement; (ii) Chapters C2, C3, and C4 in the \ldblquote commercial provisions\rdblquote  of the 2012 edition of the International Energy Conservation Code (the \ldblquote 2012 IECC\rdblquote ), as amended by Chapter 2 of the 2014 Supplement; (iii) the 2010 edition of Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings (\ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2010\rdblquote ), as amended by Chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement; and (iv) reference standards incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR section 1240.4(c).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\cf0\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qc\ul SECTION ECC 101\par
SCOPE AND GENERAL REQUIREMENTS\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
101.1 General\b0 . These provisions shall be known and cited as the \ldblquote New York City Energy Conservation Code,\rdblquote  \ldblquote NYCECC\rdblquote  or \ldblquote ECC,\rdblquote  and are referred to herein as \ldblquote this code.\rdblquote  All section numbers in this code shall be deemed to be preceded by the designation \ldblquote ECC.\rdblquote  Administration and enforcement of this code shall be in accordance with Title 28 of the Administrative Code.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-28\qj\ulnone\b\tab\tab\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\ul 101.1.1 Titles.\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\li360\qj The 2010 edition of the Energy Conservation Construction Code of New York State shall be known as the \ldblquote 2010 ECCCNYS.\rdblquote  \par
\par
The 2012 edition of the International Energy Code shall be known as the \ldblquote 2012 IECC.\rdblquote  \par
\par
The 2010 edition of the Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings shall be known as \ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2010.\rdblquote  Where this code makes reference to ASHRAE 90.1-2010, such standard shall be as amended for New York City in accordance with Appendix A of this code. \par
\par
The 2014 Supplement to the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code shall be known as the \ldblquote 2014 Supplement.\rdblquote  \par
\par
Chapters 1, 2, 3, 4 and 6 of the 2010 ECCCNYS (as amended by Chapter 1 of the 2014 Supplement) and the referenced standards incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR Section 1240.3(b) shall be known collectively as the \ldblquote New York State Residential Energy Code.\rdblquote\par
\par
Chapter 1 of the 2010 ECCCNYS (as amended by Chapter 1 of the 2014 Supplement), Chapters C2, C3, and C4 in the \ldblquote commercial provisions\rdblquote  of the 2012 IECC (as amended by Chapter 2 of the 2014 Supplement), ASHRAE 90.1-2010 (as amended by Chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement), and the referenced standards incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR Section 1240.4(b), shall be known collectively as the \ldblquote New York State Commercial Energy Code.\rdblquote  \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\cf0 The New York State Residential Energy Code and the New York State Commercial Energy Code shall be known collectively as the \ldblquote New York State Energy Code.\rdblquote\par
\par
The New York State Energy Code along with the New York City amendments to the New York State Energy Code shall be known collectively as the \ldblquote New York City Energy Conservation Code.\rdblquote\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\fs23\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\b\fs24 101.2 Scope\b0 . This code applies to residential buildings and commercial buildings as defined in Chapter 2 and Chapter C2 of this code\ulnone .  \highlight2\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\highlight0\ul\b 101.2.1 References.\b0  Where reference is made within this code to the Building Code of New York State, Existing Building Code of New York State, Fire Code of New York State, Fuel Gas Code of New York State, Mechanical Code of New York State, Plumbing Code of New York State, Property Maintenance Code of New York State or Residential Code of New York State, the reference shall be deemed to be to the analogous provision(s) of Title 28 of the Administrative Code (the New York City Construction Codes), the 1968 Building Code, the New York City Fire Code or the New York City Electrical Code. \par
\b\par
101.2.2 Occupancy classifications.\b0   For determination of occupancy classification and use within this code, a comparable occupancy classification shall be made to the New York City Building Code.\par
\ulnone\b\par
\ul 101.2.3 Reconciliation with New York State Energy Code.\b0   Whenever any provision of the New York State Energy Code provides for a more stringent requirement than imposed by this code, the more stringent requirement shall govern.\cf3\b\par
\cf0\ulnone\par
\ul 101.2.4 Other laws. \b0 The provisions of this code shall not be deemed to nullify any federal, state or local law, rule or regulation relating to any matter as to which this code does not provide.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\ulnone\b\par
\ul 101.3 Intent.\b0   This code shall regulate the design and construction of buildings for the effective use of energy.  This code is intended to provide flexibility to permit the use of innovative approaches and techniques to achieve the effective use of energy.  This code is not intended to abridge safety, health or environmental requirements contained in other applicable codes or ordinances.  To the fullest extent feasible, use of modern technical methods, devices and improvements that tend to minimize consumption of energy and utilize to the greatest extent practical solar and other renewable energy sources without abridging reasonable requirements for the safety, health and security of the occupants or users of buildings shall be permitted. As far as may be practicable, the improvement of energy conservation construction practices, methods, equipment, materials and techniques shall be encouraged.\par
\b\par
101.4 Applicability.\b0   The provisions of this code shall apply to the construction of buildings. Where, in any specific case, different sections of this code specify different materials, methods of construction or other requirements, the most restrictive shall govern. Where there is a conflict between a general requirement and a specific requirement, the specific requirement shall govern.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\expndtw-3\ulnone\b\par
\ul 101.4.1 \expndtw0 Existing buildings.\b0  Except as specified in this chapter, this code shall not be used to require the removal, alteration or abandonment of, nor prevent the continued use and maintenance of, an existing building or building system lawfully in existence at the time of adoption of this code.\par
\expndtw-3\b\par
101.4.2 \expndtw0 Historic buildings.\b0   An alteration or renovation to an existing building or structure that (1) is listed in the New York State Register of Historic Places, either individually or as a contributing building to a historic district, (2) is listed in the National Register of Historic Places, either individually or as a contributing building to a historic district, (3) has been determined to be eligible for listing in either the New York State or National Register of Historic Places, either individually or as a contributing building to a historic district, by the New York State Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation, or (4) has been determined to be eligible for listing in the National Register of Historic Places, either individually or as a contributing building to a historic district, by the United States Secretary of the Interior, need not comply with this code.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\expndtw-3\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\ul\b 101.4.3 Additions, alterations, renovations or repairs.\b0   It is intended that the residential provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code shall apply to additions, alterations, and renovations of existing residential buildings in all cases where the New York State Residential Energy Code would apply, and that the commercial provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code shall apply to additions, alterations, and renovations of existing commercial buildings in all cases where ASHRAE 90.1-2010 would apply.  Additions, alterations, renovations or repairs to an existing building, building system, equipment or portion thereof\expndtw0 , other than repairs of equipment,\expndtw-3  shall conform to the provisions of this code as they relate to new construction without requiring the unaltered portion of the existing building, building system or equipment to comply with this code.  Additions, alterations, renovations or repairs shall not create an unsafe or hazardous condition or overload existing building systems.  An addition shall be deemed to comply with this code if the addition alone complies or if the existing building and addition comply with this code as a single building.\par
\expndtw0\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b Exception:\b0   The following need not comply with the provisions of this code provided that the energy use of the building is not increased:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li1440\qj\expndtw-3\par
1.\tab Storm windows installed over existing fenestration.\par
\par
2.\tab Glass-only replacements in an existing sash and frame, provided that the U-factor and the solar heat gain coefficient (SHGC) shall be equal to or lower than before the glass replacement.\par
\par
3.\tab Alterations, renovations or repairs to roof/ceiling, wall or floor cavities, including spaces between furring strips, provided that such cavities are insulated to the full existing cavity depth with insulation having a minimum nominal value of R-3.0/inch (R-2.0/cm).\par
\par
4.  Alterations, renovations or repairs to walls and floors in cases where the existing structure is without framing cavities and no new framing cavities are created.\par
\par
5.\tab Reroofing where neither the sheathing nor the insulation is exposed.  Roofs without insulation in the cavity and where the sheathing or insulation is exposed during reroofing shall be insulated either above or below the sheathing.\par
\par
6.  Replacement of existing doors that separate conditioned space from the exterior shall not require the installation of a vestibule or revolving door, provided, however, that an existing vestibule that separates a conditioned space from the exterior shall not be removed.\par
\ulnone\par
\ul 7.\tab An alteration that replaces less than 50 percent of the luminaires in a space, provided that such alteration does not increase the installed interior\ulnone  \ul lighting power.\ulnone   \par
\ul\par
8.\tab An alteration that replaces only the bulb and ballast within the existing luminaires in a space, provided that such alteration does not increase the installed interior\ulnone  \ul lighting power.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b 101.4.3.1 Prescriptive envelope compliance for additions.  \b0 Additions shall comply with Sections 101.4.3.1.1 and 101.4.3.1.2 or alternatively with ASHRAE 90.1-2010 as amended by Appendix A of this code.\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li1440\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li1080\qj 101.4.3.1.1 Vertical fenestration.\b0   New vertical fenestration area that results in a total building fenestration area less than or equal to that specified in Section C402.3.1 shall comply with Section C402.3.  Additions with vertical fenestration that result in a total building fenestration area greater than Section C402.3.1 or additions that exceed the fenestration area greater than Section C402.3.1 shall comply with Section C402.3.1.1 for the addition only.  Additions that result in a total building vertical glass area exceeding that specified in Section C402.3.1.1 shall comply with Section C407.\par
\b\par
101.4.3.1.2 Skylight area.\b0   New skylight area that results in a total building fenestration area less than or equal to that specified in Section C402.3.1 shall comply with Section C402.3.  Additions with skylight area that result in a total building skylight area greater than Section C402.3.1 or additions that exceed the skylight area greater than Section C402.3.1 shall comply with Section C402.3.1.2 for the addition only.  Additions that result in a total building skylight area exceeding that specified in Section C402.3.1.2 shall comply with Section C407.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\par
\b 101.4.3.2 Alterations to building envelope.\b0   New building envelope assemblies that are part of the alteration shall comply with Sections 101.4.3.2.1 and 101.4.3.2.2 or alternatively with ASHRAE 90.1-2010 as amended by Appendix A of this code.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li1080\qj\b 101.4.3.2.1 Vertical fenestration.\b0   The addition of vertical fenestration that results in a total building fenestration area less than or equal to that specified in Section C402.3.1 shall comply with Section C402.3.  The addition of vertical fenestration that results in a total building fenestration area greater than Section C402.3.1 shall comply with Section C402.3.1.1 for the space adjacent to the new fenestration only.  Alterations that result in a total building vertical glass area exceeding that specified in Section C402.3.1.1 shall comply with Section C407.\par
\par
\b 101.4.3.2.2 Skylight Area.\b0   The addition of skylight area that results in a total building skylight area less than or equal to that specified in Section C402.3.1 shall comply with Section C402.3.  The addition of skylight area that results in a total building skylight area greater than Section C402.3.1 shall comply with Section C402.3.1.2 for the space adjacent to the new skylights.  Alterations that result in a total building skylight area exceeding that specified in Section C402.3.1.2 shall comply with Section C407.  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\highlight4\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\highlight0\ul 101.4.4 Change in occupancy or use.\b0   Spaces undergoing a change in occupancy that would result in an increase in demand for either fossil fuel or electrical energy shall comply with this code.  Where the use of a space changes from one use in Table\ulnone  \ul C405.5.2(1) or (2) to another use in Table\ulnone  \ul C405.5.2(1) or C405.5.2(2), the installed lighting wattage shall comply with Section\ulnone  \ul C405.5\ulnone .\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\highlight4\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\highlight0\ul 101.4.5 Change in space conditioning.\b0   Any non-conditioned space that is altered to become conditioned space shall comply with this code.\par
\ulnone\b\par
\ul 101.4.6 Mixed occupancy.\b0   Where a building includes both residential and commercial occupancies, each occupancy shall be separately considered\expndtw0  and shall meet the applicable provisions of Chapter 4 for residential and Chapter C4 for commercial\expndtw-3\ulnone .\expndtw0  \expndtw-3\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\highlight4\b\par
\highlight0\ul 101.5 Compliance.\ulnone\b0  \expndtw0\ul\fs23 Residential buildings shall comply with the provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code applicable to residential buildings. Commercial buildings shall comply with the provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code applicable to commercial buildings\expndtw-3\ulnone\fs24 .\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\b\par
\ul 101.5.1 Compliance software\cf3\b0  \cf0 The use of computer software to demonstrate compliance with this code shall be in accordance with the requirements of Sections 101.5.1.1 or 101.5.1.2.\cf3\par
\highlight2\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\cf0\highlight0\b 101.5.1.1  Residential buildings.  \expndtw0\b0\fs23 Compliance with the residential provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code can be demonstrated through the use of (i) computer software that is developed by the United States Department of Energy (such as REScheck, REM/Rate home energy rating or REM/Design Home energy analysis software) specifically for the New York State Residential Energy Code, or (ii) any other building energy modeling or home energy rating (HERS) software that shall have been expressly approved in writing by the New York Secretary of State as acceptable for demonstrating compliance with the New York State Residential Energy Code. Software programs used to show compliance with the residential provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code must indicate compliance with the New York State Residential Energy Code, and must reflect the actual requirements of the residential provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code. When using the software approach to show compliance, the mandatory code provisions of the residential provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code must be followed.\ulnone\b  \ul\par
\b0\par
\expndtw-3\b\fs24 101.5.1.2  Commercial buildings.  \expndtw0\b0\fs23 Compliance with the commercial provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code can be demonstrated through the use of (i) computer software that is developed by the United States Department of Energy (such as COMCheck) specifically for the New York State Commercial Energy Code (or specifically for ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by Chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement), or (ii) other software that shall have been expressly approved in writing by the New York Secretary of State as acceptable for demonstrating compliance with the New York State Commercial Energy Code (or for demonstrating compliance with ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by Chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement). Software programs used to show compliance with the commercial provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code must indicate compliance with the New York State Commercial Energy Code (or compliance with ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by Chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement), and must reflect the actual requirements of the commercial provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code (or the actual requirements of ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by Appendix A of this code). When using the software approach to show compliance with the commercial provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code, the mandatory code provisions in Chapters C2 through C5 (or, if applicable, the mandatory provisions of ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by Appendix A of the New York City Energy Conservation Code) must be followed.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\highlight4\ulnone\b\par
\highlight0\expndtw-3\ul\fs24 101.\expndtw0 5.2 Low-energy buildings.\b0   The following buildings, or portions thereof separated from the remainder of the building by building thermal envelope assemblies complying with this code, shall be exempt from the building thermal envelope provisions of this code:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li1080\qj\par
1.\tab Those with a peak design rate of energy use less than 3.4 Btu/h per square foot (10.7 W/m\super 2\nosupersub ) or 1.0 watt per square foot (10.7 W/m\super 2\nosupersub ) of floor area for space conditioning purposes.\par
\par
2.  Those that do not contain conditioned space.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\ulnone\b\par
\ul 101.5.3 Demonstration of compliance.\b0  For a building project application or applications required to be submitted to the department, the following documentation, as further described in the rules of the department, shall be required in order to demonstrate compliance with this code:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ulnone\b\par
\ul 101.5.3.1 Professional\b0  \b statement.\b0  Any registered design professional or lead energy professional filing an application or applications for a new building or alteration project shall provide on a signed and sealed drawing a statement of compliance or exemption in accordance with the rules of the department.\par
\b\par
101.5.3.2 Energy analysis.\b0  For any application that is not exempt from this code and for which a work permit is required in accordance with Section 28-105 of the Administrative Code, an energy analysis shall be provided on a sheet or sheets within the construction drawing set.  The energy analysis shall identify the compliance path followed, demonstrate how the design complies with this code and be in a format as prescribed in the rules of the department.  The energy analysis shall meet the requirements of this code for the entire project. Projects that utilize trade-offs among disciplines shall use DOE2-based energy modeling programs or other energy-modeling programs as prescribed in the rules of the department and shall be signed and sealed by a lead energy professional. \par
\b\par
101.5.3.3 Supporting documentation.\b0  For any application that is not exempt from this code and for which a work permit is required in accordance with Section 28-105 of the Administrative Code, supporting documentation shall be required in the approved construction drawings.  See Section 103 for further requirements.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\cf1\ulnone\b\par
\ul 101.6 Severability. \b0 If a section, subsection, sentence, clause or phrase of this code is, for any reason, held to be unconstitutional, such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this code. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qc\cf0\ulnone\b\par
\ul SECTION ECC 102\par
ALTERNATE MATERIALS, METHOD OF CONSTRUCTION, DESIGN OR INSULATING SYSTEMS\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
102.1 General.  \b0 This code is not intended to prevent the use of any material, method of construction, design or insulating system not specifically prescribed herein, provided that such material, method of construction, design or insulating system has been approved by the commissioner as (1) meeting the intent of this code, (2) achieving energy savings that are equivalent to or greater than would be achieved using prescribed materials, methods of construction, designs or insulating systems, and (3) meeting the requirements of Article 113 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code and the remaining New York City Construction Codes. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\ulnone\b\par
\ul 102.1.1 Above-code programs.\b0   The commissioner shall be permitted to find that a national, state or local energy efficiency program exceeds the energy efficiency required by this code.  Buildings approved in writing by such an energy efficiency program shall be considered in compliance with this code.  Notwithstanding approval by such an energy efficiency program, the requirements identified as \ldblquote mandatory\rdblquote  in Chapters 4 and C4 of this code shall still apply.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\highlight4\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qc\highlight0\ul SECTION ECC 103\par
CONSTRUCTION DOCUMENTS\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
103.1 General.  \b0 Construction documents shall be prepared in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code, the New York City Construction Codes, including this code, and the rules of the department.\par
\cf1\b\par
103.2 Supporting documentation on construction documents. \cf0\b0 Supporting documentation shall include those construction documents that demonstrate compliance with this code. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\ulnone\b\par
\ul 103.2.1  Intent. \b0  Supporting documentation shall accomplish the following:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li1080\qj 1.  Demonstrate conformance of approved drawings to the energy analysis for every element and value of the energy analysis;\par
\par
2. Demonstrate conformance of approved drawings to other mandatory requirements of this code, including, but not limited, to, sealing against air leakage from the building envelope and from ductwork as applicable, insulation of ducts and piping as applicable, mechanical and lighting controls with devices shown and operational narratives for each, and additional requirements as set forth in this section;\par
\par
3.  Identify required progress inspections in accordance with the scope of work, this code, the Administrative Code, the New York City Building Code and the rules of the department; and\par
\par
4.  Comply with other requirements as may be set forth in the rules of the department.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\cf1\ulnone\b\par
\ul 103.2.2 Detailed requirements.\b0   Construction documents shall be drawn to scale upon suitable material. Electronic media documents are permitted to be submitted in accordance with department procedures. Construction documents for a project shall be fully coordinated and of sufficient clarity to indicate the location, nature and extent of the work proposed, and show in sufficient detail pertinent data and features of the building, building systems and equipment as herein governed. Details shall include, but are not limited to, as applicable, insulation materials and their R-values; fenestration U-factors and SHGCs; area-weighted U-factor and SHGC calculations; mechanical system design criteria; mechanical and service water heating system and equipment, types, sizes and efficiencies; economizer description; equipment and systems controls; fan motor horsepower and controls; duct sealing, duct and pipe insulation and location; lighting fixture schedule with wattages and control narrative; and air sealing details. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\ulnone\b\par
\ul 103.3 Examination of documents.\b0   In accordance with Article 104 \cf0 of Chapter 1\cf1  of Title 28 of the Administrative Code, the department shall examine or cause to be examined the accompanying construction documents and shall ascertain by such examinations whether the construction indicated and described is in accordance with the requirements of this code and other pertinent laws, rules and regulations.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\b\par
103.4 Changes during construction.\b0   Changes made during construction that are not in compliance with the approved construction documents shall be resubmitted for approval as an amended set of construction documents.\b  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qc\ulnone\par
\ul SECTION ECC 104\par
INSPECTIONS\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
104.1 General.  \b0 Except as otherwise specifically provided, inspections required by this code or by the department during the progress of work may be performed on behalf of the owner by an approved agency.  All inspections shall be performed at the sole cost and expense of the owner.  Refer to Article 116 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code for additional provisions relating to inspections.  In addition to any inspections otherwise required by this code or the rules of the department, the following inspections shall be required:\b   \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\ulnone\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li720\qj\ul 1.  Progress inspections. \b  \b0 Progress inspections shall be performed in accordance with the rules of the department.\b\par
\b0\par
2. \tab Final inspection. Refer to Article 116 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code and the rules of the department.\par
\par
3. \tab Issuance of Certificate of Compliance. Refer to Section 28-116.4.1 of the Administrative Code.  \par
\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\ul The requirements of Section 104.1 shall not be read to prohibit the operation of any heating equipment or appliances installed to replace existing heating equipment or appliances serving an occupied portion of a structure provided that a request for inspection of such heating equipment or appliances has been filed with the department not more than 48 hours after such replacement work is completed, and before any portion of such equipment or appliances is concealed by any permanent portion of the structure.  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li720\qj\tx360\tx1440\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\tx360\tx1440\ul 104.1.1\tab Approved agencies.\b0   Refer to Article 114 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code and the rules of the department.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\b\par
104.1.2\tab  Inspection of prefabricated construction assemblies.\b0   Prior to the issuance of a work permit for a prefabricated construction assembly having concealed mechanical work, the department shall require the submittal of an evaluation report by the manufacturer or approved agency on each prefabricated construction assembly, indicating the complete details of the mechanical system, including a description of the system and its components, the basis upon which the system is being evaluated for energy use, test results and similar information, and other data as necessary for the commissioner to determine conformance to this code.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\tx1800\b\par
104.1.2.1\tab Test and inspection records.\b0   Required test and inspection records shall be made available to the commissioner at all times during the fabrication of the mechanical system and the erection of the building; or such records as the commissioner designates shall be filed.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx0\tx1080\ulnone\b\par
\ul 104.2 Testing.\b0   Envelope, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, service water heating, lighting and electrical systems shall be tested as required in this code and in accordance with Sections 104.2.1 through 104.2.3.  Except as otherwise required in this code or in the rules of the department, tests shall be made by the permit holder and witnessed by an approved agency.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\tx360\tx1440\b\par
104.2.1 New, altered, extended, renovated or repaired systems.\b0   New envelope, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, service water heating, lighting and electrical installations or  systems, and parts of existing systems that have been altered, extended, renovated or repaired, shall be tested as prescribed herein or in the rules of the department to disclose leaks and defects.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\b\par
104.2.2 Apparatus, instruments, material and labor for tests.\b0   Apparatus, instruments, material and labor required for testing an envelope, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, service water heating, lighting and/or electrical installation or system or part thereof shall be furnished by the permit holder. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\tx1440\b\par
104.2.3 Reinspection and testing.\b0   Where any work or installation does not pass an initial test or inspection, the necessary corrections shall be made so as to achieve compliance with \cf0 the New York City Construction Codes, including this code\cf1 .  The work or installation shall then be reinspected or retested by the approved agency.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\ulnone\b\par
\ul 104.3 Sign-off of completed work.\b0   In addition to the requirements of Article 116 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code, Section 103.4 of this code and other requirements for sign-off, the project team shall either certify that construction does not differ from the last approved energy analysis or provide a whole-project as-built energy analysis and supporting documents, signed and sealed, for approval prior to sign-off.  The as-built energy analysis and supporting documents shall reflect the materials, equipment and values actually used in the construction of the project, and shall demonstrate compliance of the constructed project with this code.  \cf0 Such signed and sealed documents may be accepted with less than full examination by the department based on the professional certification of the registered design professional.\par
\cf1\b\par
104.4 Temporary connection.\b0   The commissioner shall have the authority to allow the temporary connection of an installation to the sources of energy for the purpose of testing the installation or for use under a temporary certificate of occupancy. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qc\ulnone\b\par
\ul SECTION ECC 105\par
REFERENCED STANDARDS\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\cf0\par
105.1 Referenced standards. \b0 The standards referenced in Chapters 2, 3, and 4 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code shall be those that are listed in Chapter 6 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code, and in the rules of the department and such standards shall be considered part of the requirements of\ulnone  \ul the residential provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code\ulnone  \ul to the prescribed extent of each such reference. The standards referenced in Chapters C2, C3, and C4 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code shall be those that are listed in Chapter C5 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code, and in the rules of the department and such standards shall be considered part of the requirements of the commercial provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code to the prescribed extent of each such reference.  Where differences occur between provisions of this code and the referenced standards, the provisions of this code shall apply. Refer to Article 103 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code for additional provisions relating to referenced standards. \cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\cf0\b\par
CHAPTER 2\par
DEFINITIONS\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qc SECTION 202\par
GENERAL DEFINITIONS\par
\caps\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\b0\caps0 Revise the definition of \ldblquote Addition\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Accessible,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b ADDITION.\b0  An extension or increase in the conditioned space floor area or height of a building or structure.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\ul Revise the definition of \ldblquote Approved\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Alteration,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b APPROVED.\b0  See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\ulnone\par

\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx630\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\tab\ul Revise the term \ldblquote Code enforcement official\rdblquote  and add the term \ldblquote Code official\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote C-factor (thermal conductance),\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\tx630\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-720\li720\qj\tx630\tab\b\tab\ul CODE ENFORCEMENT OFFICIAL.\b0  The commissioner or the commissioner\rquote s designee.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-720\li720\qj\tx720\ulnone\b\tab\ul CODE OFFICIAL.\b0  The commissioner or the commissioner\rquote s designee.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-720\li720\qj\tx630\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\tx0\tab\ul Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote Grade plane\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote F-factor,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\tx720\b GRADE PLANE.\b0  For the purposes of this code, a reference plane representing the average of finished ground level adjoining the building at exterior walls. Where the finished ground level slopes away from the exterior walls, the reference plane shall be established by the lowest points within the area between the building and the lot line or, where the lot line is more than 6 feet (1829 mm) from the building, between the building and a point 6 feet (1829 mm) from the building.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\tx0\par
Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote Lead energy professional\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Labeled,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b LEAD ENERGY PROFESSIONAL.\b0   The registered design professional who signs and seals the energy analysis for an entire project.  Such individual may be the same registered design professional who signs and seals the design drawings for the same project.\par
\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\tab\ul Add new definitions of \ldblquote Professional certification\rdblquote  and \ldblquote Project\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Nameplate Horsepower,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION. \b0 See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code.\cf5   \cf0\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\ulnone\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b PROJECT.\b0   A design and construction undertaking comprised of work related to one or more buildings and the site improvements. A project is represented by one or more plan/work applications, including construction documents compiled in accordance with Section 107 of the New York City Building Code, that relate either to the construction of a new building or buildings or to the demolition or alteration of an existing building or buildings. Applications for a project may have different registered design professionals and different job numbers, and may result in the issuance of one or more permits.\ulnone  \expndtw-3  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\expndtw0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\ul\b CHAPTER 3\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj CLIMATE ZONES, DESIGN CONDITIONS, MATERIALS, EQUIPMENT AND SYSTEMS\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj 301.1 General.\par
\b0 Delete Section 301.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section 301.1 to read as follows:\ulnone  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\ul\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b 301.1 General.\b0  Climate zones from Table 301.1 shall be used in determining the applicable requirements from Chapter 4.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720 CHAPTER 4\par
RESIDENTIAL ENERGY EFFICIENCY\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720 403.7 Systems serving multiple dwelling units.\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj Delete Section 403.7 in its entirety and replace with a new Section 403.7 to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b 403.7 Systems serving multiple dwelling units.\b0  Systems serving buildings containing three or more dwelling units shall comply with Sections C403 and C404 in lieu of Section 403.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b 403.9 Pools.\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj Delete Section 403.9 in its entirety and replace with a new Section 403.9 to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b 403.9 Pools. \b0 Pools shall be provided with energy-conserving measures in accordance with Sections 403.9.1 through 403.9.3.\par
\pard\ltrpar\li1440\sb130\sa130\qj\b 403.9.1 Pool heaters. \expndtw1\b0 All pool heaters shall be equipped with a readily accessible on-off switch to allow shutting off the heater without adjusting the thermostat setting. Pool heaters fired by natural gas or LPG shall not have continuously burning pilot lights.\expndtw0\b\f1\par
\f0 403.9.2 Time switches. \expndtw1\b0 Time switches that can automatically turn off and on heaters and pumps according to a preset schedule shall be installed on swimming pool heaters and pumps.\expndtw0\b\f1\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi-720\li2880\sb130\sa130\qj\f0 Exceptions:\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-720\li2880\sb130\sa130\qj\tx1440\expndtw1\b0 1.\tab Where public health standards require 24-hour pump operation.\par
2.\tab Where pumps are required to operate solar- and waste-heat-recovery pool-heating systems.\par
\pard\ltrpar\li1440\sb130\sa130\qj\expndtw0\b 403.9.3 Pool covers. \expndtw1\b0 Heated pools shall be equipped with a vapor-retardant pool cover on or at the water surface. Pools heated to more than 90\'b0F (32\'b0C) shall have a pool cover with a minimum insulation value of R-12.\expndtw0\b\f1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li2160\qj\f0 Exception:\b0  \expndtw1 Pools deriving over 60 percent of the energy for heating from site-recovered energy or solar energy source.\expndtw0\par

\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\tx0\highlight0\b0\tab\ul Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote Electrical design load\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Economizer, water,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi-720\li720\qj\tx630\ulnone\b\tab  \ul ELECTRICAL DESIGN LOAD.\b0  The electrical load that feeders and branch circuits are required to support pursuant to the relevant provisions of the New York City Electrical Code for the category of equipment loads being supported.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\tx0\par
Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote Grade plane\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote General lighting,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\tx720\b GRADE PLANE.\b0  For the purposes of this code, a reference plane representing the average of finished ground level adjoining the building at exterior walls. Where the finished ground level slopes away from the exterior walls, the reference plane shall be established by the lowest points within the area between the building and the lot line or, where the lot line is more than 6 feet (1829 mm) from the building, between the building and a point 6 feet (1829 mm) from the building.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\tx0\ulnone\par
\ul Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote Lead energy professional\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Labeled,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b LEAD ENERGY PROFESSIONAL.\b0   The registered design professional who signs and seals the energy analysis for an entire project.  Such individual may be the same registered design professional who signs and seals the design drawings for the same project.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx630\highlight4\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\highlight0\ul\b0 Add a new definition of "Occupancy sensor" after the definition of "Nonstandard part load value (NPLV),\rdblquote  to read as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b OCCUPANCY SENSOR.\b0  A device that detects the presence or absence of people within an area and causes lighting, equipment, or appliances to be regulated accordingly.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx630\highlight6\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\highlight0\ul\b0 Add new definitions of "Photosensor" and \ldblquote Professional certification\rdblquote  and \ldblquote Project\rdblquote  after the definition of "On-Site renewable energy," to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\ul\b PHOTOSENSOR.\b0  A device that detects the presence of visible light.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx630\highlight4\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\highlight0\ul PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION. \b0 See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code.\cf5   \cf0\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx630\highlight4\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\highlight0\ul PROJECT.\b0   A design and construction undertaking comprised of work related to one or more buildings and the site improvements. A project is represented by one or more plan/work applications, including construction documents compiled in accordance with Section 107 of the New York City Building Code, that relate either to the construction of a new building or buildings or to the demolition or alteration of an existing building or buildings. Applications for a project may have different registered design professionals and different job numbers, and may result in the issuance of one or more permits. \expndtw-3  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx630\expndtw0\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\ul\b0 Revise the definition of \ldblquote Vapor Retarder Class\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Vapor Retarder,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\tx630\b VAPOR RETARDER CLASS.\b0  A vapor retarder shall be classified in accordance with its permeance rating measured in \ldblquote perm\rdblquote  (1 perm = 5.7 \'d7 10\super -11\nosupersub  kg/Pa \f3\fs18\bullet\f0\fs24  s \f3\fs18\bullet\f0\fs24  m\super 2\nosupersub ) when tested in accordance with the desiccant method using Procedure A of ASTM E 96-00, as follows:\par
\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li1440\qj\tx1440\ul Class I vapor retarder:\b0  a vapor retarder having a permeance rating of 0.1 perm or less.\par
\par
\b Class II vapor retarder:\b0  a vapor retarder having a permeance rating that is more than 0.1 perm and less than or equal to 1.0 perm.\par
\par
\b Class III vapor retarder:\b0  a vapor retarder having a permeance rating that is more than 1.0 perm and less than or equal to 10.0 perm.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx630\highlight4\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\li720\highlight0\ul CHAPTER C4\caps\par
\caps0 COMMERCIAL ENERGY EFFICIENCY\caps\par

GENERAL\par

3.   Performance. The requirements of Section C407.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\b C401.2.1  Application to existing buildings.\par
\ulnone\tab\ul\b0 Delete Item 3 and replace with a new Item 3 to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\li720\qj 3. The requirements of ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by Appendix A of the New York City Energy Conservation Code.\par

\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qc SECTION C402\par
BUILDING ENVELOPE REQUIREMENTS\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\par
C402.1.1  Insulation and fenestration criteria.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\b0 The reference to \ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by Chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement\rdblquote  shall be deemed to be a reference to \ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by Appendix A of the New York City Energy Conservation Code.\rdblquote\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx0\b C402.4.4 Doors and access openings to shafts, chutes, stairways, and elevator lobbies.\b0  \par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\tx720 Delete Section C402.4.4 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C402.4.4 to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b C402.4.4 Doors and access openings to shafts, chutes, stairways, and elevator lobbies.\b0  Doors and access openings from conditioned space to shafts, chutes, stairways and elevator lobbies shall either meet the requirements of Section C402.4.3 or shall be gasketed, weatherstripped or sealed. \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li1440\qj\b Exception:\b0  Door openings required to comply with Section 715 or 715.3 of the New York City Building Code; or doors and door openings required by the New York City Building Code to comply with UL 1784 shall not be required to comply with Section C402.4.4.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\highlight6\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\highlight0\b C402.4.9.1 Class III vapor retarders.\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\tx720 Delete Section C402.4.9.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C402.4.9.1 to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b C402.4.9.1 Class III vapor retarders.\b0  When a vapor retarder is required by Section C402.4.9, a Class III vapor retarder may be provided in lieu of a Class I or II vapor retarder for framed walls, floors, and ceilings made of the materials indicated in Table C402.4.9.1.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li1440\qj\b Exception:\b0  Nothing in this section C402.4.9.1 or in Table C402.4.9.1 shall be construed as permitting a Class III vapor retarder in any situation where a Class I or Class II vapor retarder is required by the 2010 Building Code of New York State, the Residential Code of New York State or the Building Code of New York City, as applicable. \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\b C402.4.9.2 Material vapor retarder class.\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\tx720 Delete Section C402.4.9.2 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C402.4.9.2 to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\tx720\b C402.4.9.2 Material vapor retarder class.\b0  A vapor retarder shall be classified in accordance with its permeance rating measured in \ldblquote perm\rdblquote  (1 perm = 5.7 \'d7 10\super -11\nosupersub  kg/Pa \f3\fs18\bullet\f0\fs24  s \f3\fs18\bullet\f0\fs24  m\super 2\nosupersub ) when tested in accordance with the desiccant method using Procedure A of ASTM E 96, as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li1440\qj\tx1440\b Class I vapor retarder:\b0  a vapor retarder having a permeance rating of 0.1 perm or less.\par
\par
\b Class II vapor retarder:\b0  a vapor retarder having a permeance rating that is more than 0.1 perm and less than or equal to 1.0 perm.\par
\par
\b Class III vapor retarder:\b0  a vapor retarder having a permeance rating that is more than 1.0 perm and less than or equal to 10.0 perm.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\tx720 The vapor retarder class shall be based on the testing of the vapor retarder or an assembly that includes the vapor retarder, such testing to be performed and certified by the manufacturer of the vapor retarder or by an approved independent testing organization. However, in the absence of certified test results indicating that a different class is appropriate, the following materials shall be deemed to be in the class specified:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li1440\qj\tx1440\b Class I:\b0  Sheet polyethylene, non-perforated aluminum foil\par
\par
\b Class II:\b0  Kraft faced fiberglass batts\par
\par
\b Class III:\b0  Latex or enamel paint\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\cf7\highlight2\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qc\cf0\highlight0\b SECTION C403\par

\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\tx720\b C403.1 General.\b0  Mechanical systems and equipment serving the building heating, cooling or ventilating needs shall comply with Sections C403.2.1, C403.2.2, C403.2.3, C403.2.4, C403.2.5, C403.2.7, C403.2.8, C403.2.9, and C403.2.11 (referred to as the mandatory provisions) and either:\par
\par
1. Section C403.3 (Simple systems); or\par
\par
2. Section C403.4 (Complex systems).\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\tx720\ulnone\par

a.\tab Chapter 6 of the referenced standard contains a complete specification of the referenced test procedure, including the referenced year version of the test procedure.\par
b.\tab Minimum and maximum ratings as provided for and allowed by the unit\rquote s controls.\par
c.\tab Combination units not covered by the National Appliance Energy Conservation Act of 1987 (NAECA) (3-phase power or cooling capacity greater than or equal to 65,000 Btu/h [19 kW]) shall comply with either rating.\par
d.\tab E\dn16\fs16 t \up0\fs18 = Thermal efficiency. See test procedure for detailed discussion.\par
e.\tab E\dn16\fs16 c\up0\fs18  = Combustion efficiency (100% less flue losses). See test procedure for detailed discussion.\par
f.\tab E\dn16\fs16 c\up0\fs18  = Combustion efficiency. Units must also include an IID, have jackets not exceeding 0.75 percent of the input rating, and have either power venting or a flue damper. A vent damper is an acceptable alternative to a flue damper for those furnaces where combustion air is drawn from the conditioned space.\par
g.\tab E\dn16\fs16 t \up0\fs18 = Thermal efficiency. Units must also include an IID, have jacket losses not exceeding 0.75 percent of the input rating, and have either power venting or a flue damper. A vent damper is an acceptable alternative to a flue damper for those furnaces where combustion air is drawn from the conditioned space.\par

a.\tab The efficiencies and test procedures for both open and closed circuit cooling towers are not applicable to hybrid cooling towers that contain a combination of wet and dry heat exchange sections.\par
b.\tab For purposes of this table, open circuit cooling tower performance is defined as the water flow rating of the tower at the thermal rating condition listed in Table 403.2.3(8) divided by the fan nameplate rated motor power.\par
c.\tab For purposes of this table, closed circuit cooling tower performance is defined as the water flow rating of the tower at the thermal rating condition listed in Table 403.2.3(8) divided by the sum of the fan nameplate rated motor power and the spray pump nameplate rated motor power.\par
d.\tab For purposes of this table, air-cooled condenser performance is defined as the heat rejected from the refrigerant divided by the fan nameplate rated motor power.\par
e.\tab Chapter 6 of the referenced standard contains a complete specification of the referenced test procedure, including the referenced year version of the test procedure.\par
f. \tab If a certification program exists for a covered product, and it includes provisions for verification and challenge of equipment efficiency ratings, then the product shall be listed in the certification program, or, if a certification program exists for a covered product, and it includes provisions for verification and challenge of equipment efficiency ratings, but the product is not listed in the existing certification program, the ratings shall be verified by an independent laboratory test report.\par

\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li2160\qj\b C403.4.2.1.1 Static pressure sensor location. \b0 Static pressure sensors used to control VAV fans shall be placed in a position such that the controller setpoint is no greater than one-third the total design fan static pressure, except for systems with zone reset control complying with Section C403.4.2.1.2. For sensors installed down-stream of major duct splits, at least one sensor shall be located on each major branch to ensure that static pressure can be maintained in each branch.\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\li2160\ulnone\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li2160\qj\ul\b C403.4.2.1.2 Set points for direct digital control. \b0 For systems with direct digital control of individual zone boxes reporting to the central control panel, the static pressure set point shall be reset based on the zone requiring the most pressure, i.e., the set point is reset lower until one zone damper is nearly wide open.\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\highlight2\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qc\highlight0 SECTION C405\par
ELECTRICAL POWER AND LIGHTING SYSTEMS (MANDATORY)\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\par
C405.2.2.2 Occupancy sensors.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\b0 Delete Section C405.2.2.2 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C405.2.2.2 to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b C405.2.2.2 Occupancy sensors.\b0   Automatic control devices shall be installed in the following spaces to automatically turn off lights within 30 minutes of all occupants leaving the space as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj 1.\tab  Occupancy sensors shall be installed in all classrooms (not including shop classrooms, laboratory classrooms, and preschool classrooms), conference/meeting rooms, employee lunch and break rooms, and offices smaller than 200 square feet (18.5 m\super 2\nosupersub ) in area.  These shall be manual-on switches.  Such sensors and controls shall not have an override switch that converts from manual-on to automatic-on functionality.  The occupancy sensor may have a grace period of up to 30 seconds to turn on the lighting automatically after the sensor has turned off the lighting if occupancy is detected. \par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li1440\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj 2.\tab Occupancy sensors shall be installed in restrooms, storage rooms, private offices 200 square feet (18.5 m\super 2\nosupersub ) in area or greater, janitorial closets, and other spaces 300 square feet in area or less enclosed by floor-to-ceiling height partitions, except for spaces listed in Item 1.  These automatic control devices shall be installed to automatically turn off lights within 30 minutes of all occupants leaving the space, and shall either be manual-on or shall be controlled to automatically turn the lighting on to not more than 50 percent power.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li1800\qj\b Exception:\b0   Full automatic-on controls shall be permitted to control lighting in public corridors, stairways, restrooms, primary building entrance areas and lobbies, and areas where manual-on operation would endanger the safety or security of the room or building occupants.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\highlight4\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\highlight0\ul C405.3 Reserved.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\ulnone\b0 Add a new Section C405.3 to read as follows:\ul  \par
\par
\b C405.3 Reserved.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj C405.5.1.2 Reserved.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\ulnone\b0 Add a new Section C405.5.1.2 to read as follows:\ul  \par
\par
\b C405.5.1.2 Reserved.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
C405.6.1 Reserved.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\ulnone\b0 Add a new Section C405.6.1 to read as follows:\ul  \par
\par
\b C405.6.1 Reserved.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
C405.6.2 Exterior building lighting power.\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj Delete Section C405.6.2 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C405.6.2 to read as follows:\par
\par
\b C405.6.2 Exterior building lighting power.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b0 The total exterior lighting power allowance for all exterior building applications is the sum of the base site allowance plus the individual allowances for areas that are to be illuminated and are permitted in Table C405.6.2(2) for the applicable lighting zone. Tradeoffs are allowed only among exterior lighting applications listed in Table C405.6.2(2), Tradable Surfaces section. The lighting zone for the building exterior is determined from Table C405.6.2(1) unless otherwise specified by the local jurisdiction. Exterior lighting for all applications (except those included in the exceptions to Section C405.6.2) shall comply with the requirements of Section C405.6.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li1440\qj\b Exception:\b0  Lighting used for the following exterior applications is exempt where equipped with a control device independent of the control of the nonexempt lighting:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi-720\li2160\qj 1.\tab Specialized signal, directional and marker lighting associated with transportation;\par
2.\tab Advertising signage or directional signage;\par
3.\tab Integral to equipment or instrumentation and is installed by its manufacturer;\par
4.\tab Theatrical purposes, including performance, stage, film production and video production;\par
5.\tab Athletic playing areas;\par
6.\tab Temporary lighting;\par
7.\tab Industrial production, material handling, transportation sites and associated storage areas;\par
8.\tab Theme elements in theme/amusement parks; and\par
9.\tab Used to highlight features of public monuments and registered historic landmark structures or buildings.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\b\par
C405.7.1  Electrical sub-metering (mandatory). \par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj\b0 Add a new section C405.7.1 to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qc\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\ul\b C405.7.1  Measurement of electrical consumption of tenant spaces in covered buildings constructed on and after January 1, 2016.  \b0 The terms meter, submeter, covered building, tenant space and covered tenant space shall be as defined in Section 28-311.2 of the Administrative Code of the city of New York.  Each covered tenant space in a building where plans were filed with the department on and after January 1, 2016 shall be equipped with a separate meter or sub-meter to measure the electrical consumption of such space when let or sublet. Where the covered tenant space is a floor with multiple tenancies, each tenancy that is 10,000 gross square feet (929 m\super 2\nosupersub ) in area or less shall (i) be equipped with a separate meter or sub-meter, (ii) share a meter or sub-meter with other tenant spaces on the floor, or (iii) share a meter or sub-meter covering the entire floor.  As new covered tenant spaces are created, they shall be equipped with meters or sub-meters as provided in this section.\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\par
Exception:\b0  Covered tenant space for which the electrical consumption within such space is measured by a meter dedicated exclusively to that space.\highlight2\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qc\highlight0\ul SECTION C407\par
TOTAL BUILDING PERFORMANCE\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\b0 Delete  Section C407 in its entirety and replace with a new section C407 to read as follows: \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qc\b SECTION C407\par
TOTAL BUILDING PERFORMANCE\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b C407.1 Scope.\b0  This section establishes criteria for compliance using total building performance.  Buildings following the total building performance path must comply with ASHRAE 90.1-2010 as amended by Appendix A of this code, demonstrating compliance under Section 11 or Appendix G of such standard.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qc\ul\b SECTION C408\par
SYSTEM COMMISSIONING\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\b0\par
\b Section C408.1  General.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\ulnone\b0\tab\ul Delete Section C408.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C408.1 to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b C408.1  General.\b0   This section covers the commissioning of building mechanical systems in Section C403, service water heating systems in Section C404, and electrical power and lighting systems in Section C405.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\ulnone\par
\ul\b C408.2 Mechanical systems commissioning and completion requirements.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\b0 Delete Section C408.2 in its entirely and replace with a new Section C408.2 with a new title, to read as follows:\cf9\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\cf0\b C408.2 Mechanical, renewable energy, and service water heating systems commissioning and completion requirements.\b0  Prior to passing the final mechanical inspection, the registered design professional shall provide evidence of mechanical systems commissioning and completion in accordance the provisions of this section.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\li720\qj Construction document notes shall clearly indicate provisions for commissioning and completion requirements in accordance with this section and are permitted to refer to specifications for further requirements. Copies of all documentation shall be given to the owner and shall be made available to the code official upon request in accordance with Sections C408.2.4 and C408.2.5.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\li720\qj\ul Mechanical systems, renewable energy, and service water heating systems shall include but are not limited to, at a minimum, the following heating, ventilating, air conditioning, service water heating, indoor air quality and refrigeration systems (mechanical and/or passive) and associated controls:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul 1.\tab Heating, cooling, air handling and distribution, ventilation, and exhaust systems, and their related air quality monitoring systems.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li1440\qj\par
2.\tab Air, water, and other energy recovery systems.\par
\par
3.  Manual or automatic controls, whether local or remote, on energy using systems including but not limited to temperature controls, setback sequences, and occupancy based control, including energy management functions of the building management system.\par
\par
4.\tab Plumbing, including insulation of piping and associated valves, domestic and process water pumping, and mixing systems.\par
\par
5.\tab Mechanical heating systems and service water heating systems.\par
\par
6.\tab Refrigeration systems.\par
\par
7.\tab Renewable energy and energy storage systems.\par
\par
8. Other systems, equipment and components that are used for heating, cooling or ventilation and that affect energy use.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li1080\qj\ul Exception: \b0 Mechanical, renewable energy, and service hot water systems in buildings where the total mechanical equipment capacity being installed is less than 480,000 Btu/h (140 690 W) cooling capacity and 600,000 Btu/h (175 860 W) heating capacity are exempt from the commissioning requirements.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\highlight4\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\highlight0\ul C408.2.1  Commissioning plan.\b0\par
\ulnone\b\tab\ul\b0 Delete Item 2 and replace with a new Item 2 to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi-270\li990\qj 2. A listing of the specific equipment, appliances or systems to be tested, their full sequences of operation, and a description of the tests to be performed, including prerequisite activities and reference to specific checklists or worksheets which are necessary or required by the department.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\b C408.2.3.1 Equipment.\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720 Delete the exception in this section and replace with a new exception to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\b Exception:\b0  Unitary or packaged HVAC equipment listed in Tables C403.2.3(1) through C403.2.3(3) that do not require supply air economizers shall only be required to demonstrate functioning under full-load and part-load conditions.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\ul\b C408.2.5.4  Final commissioning report.\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720 Delete the language in the first sentence before the colon and replace with new language to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj\par
Within 30 months for buildings 500,000 gross square feet (46 452 m\'b2) or greater, excluding R-2 occupancies, or within 18 months for R-2 occupancies and all other buildings, of the issuance of the certificate of occupancy or letter of completion, a registered design professional or approved agency shall prepare a report of test procedures and results, including test procedures and results performed after occupancy, identified as the "Final Commissioning Report\rdblquote , provide such report to the building owner, and submit a certification to the department with applicable fees in accordance with department rules.  The owner of a building 500,000 gross square feet (46 452 m\'b2) or greater may apply for an extension of time to the code official based on good cause, in accordance with department rules. Such report shall include:\par

\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\sa240\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\b\'a728-1001.2.3 New York city amendments to the 2010 edition of Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings (\ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2010\rdblquote ), as amended by Chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement.  \b0 The New York city amendments to ASHRAE 90.1-2010 are as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj For the purpose of applying ASHRAE 90.1-2010 in the NYCECC, modifications to ASHRAE 90.1-2010 pursuant to Chapter 3 of the 2014 supplement and New York City amendments of such standard pursuant to this section are deemed to be incorporated in a new Appendix A to be inserted after chapter C5 of the NYCECC and to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qc\ul APPENDIX A\par
\par
MODIFIED ENERGY STANDARD FOR BUILDINGS, EXCEPT FOR LOW-RISE RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS\par
\par
SECTION ECC Al01\par
SCOPE\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
Al0l.1 Scope. \b0 This appendix provides the modifications to the nationally recognized standard ASHRAE 90.1-2010 , governing commercial energy efficiency. Where a referenced publication has been modified for the City of New York as by the New York City Construction Codes and the New York City Energy Conservation Code, every reference to such publication shall be deemed to include all such modifications.\b\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qc SECTION ECC A102\par
ENERGY STANDARD FOR COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
A102.1 General. \b0 The standards for energy efficiency in commercial buildings, as defined in Section C202 of this code, shall be in accordance with Chapter C4 of this code or in accordance with ASHRAE 90.1-2010 as amended by chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement and Section 28-1001.2.3 of the Administrative Code.  Refer to the rules of the department for any subsequent additions, modifications or deletions that may have been made to this standard in accordance with Section 28-103.19 of the Administrative Code.\par
\par
\b A102.2  New York City amendments.\b0   The following New York City amendments to ASHRAE 90.1-2010, as amended by chapter 3 of the 2014 Supplement, are hereby adopted as set forth in this section. \par
\par
\b Chapter 6 - Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning\par
\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\ul 6.7.2.4 \b0 Delete Section 6.7.2.4 in its entirety and replace with a new Section 6.7.2.4 to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\b 6.7.2.4.\b0  Projects complying with this standard shall also comply with Section C408 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code in regards to system commissioning.  When demonstrating compliance with Section C408.3.1, projects following ASHRAE 90.1-2010 must demonstrate compliance with Chapter 9 of ASHRAE 90.1-2010 as required, in lieu of Section C405 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\par

\pard\ltrpar\fi-360\li360\qj\tx360\cf1\ul\f1\fs18 a.\tab Section 12 contains a complete specification of the referenced test procedure, including the referenced year version of the test procedure.\par
b.\tab Combination units not covered by the NAECA (3-phase power or cooling capacity greater than or equal to 19 kW) may comply with either rating.\par
c.\tab Compliance of multiple firing rate units shall be at the maximum firing rate.\par
d.\tab E\sub t\nosupersub = thermal \i efficiency\i0 . Units must also include an interrupted or intermittent ignition device (IID), have jacket losses not exceeding 0.75% of the input rating, and have either power venting or a \i flue damper\i0 . A vent damper is an acceptable alternative to a flue damper for those furnaces where combustion air is drawn from the conditioned space.\par
e.\tab E\sub c\nosupersub  = Combustion efficiency (100% less flue losses). See test procedure for detailed discussion.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi-360\li360\qj f.\tab As of August 8, 2008, according to the Energy Policy Act of 2005, units must also include an interrupted or intermittent ignition device (IID) and have either power venting or an automatic flue damper.\par
